title: Ticket #7025: Python bindings: Submit.__delitem__ causes SIGSEGV kill
description:
This Python script: 
# crash.py

import htcondor

s = htcondor.Submit({'foo': 'bar'})

del s['foo']
will cause an error like “python crash.py” terminated by signal SIGSEGV (Address boundary error)

TJ believes the problem is that Submit.__delitem__ tries to insert a null pointer which ends up being dereferenced elsewhere.

Current thinking is to simply remove Submit.__delitem__ because del is extremely rare in real Python code, and because we don't and don't need to satisfy the full dict interface anyway.
